### Juan Díaz-Colunga<subhead>Group Leader</subhead>

::::: grid
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
![](pics/people/jdc.jpg){.headshot-image}
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-8}
Juan holds a BSc in Physics, an MSc in Biomedical Engineering, and a PhD in Biophysics. Before joining the Spanish National Research Council as a junior group leader, he conducted postdoctoral research at the UAM School of Medicine and at Yale University’s Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology, where he worked in the laboratories of [Álvaro Sánchez](https://sanchezlaboratory.weebly.com/){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} and [C. Brandon Ogbunugafor](https://ogbunulab.yale.edu/){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}. He is broadly interested in the fields of systems biology, evolutionary genetics, and microbial ecology.

Outside the lab, he enjoys movies, videogames, and all kinds of sports.

**Email:** [juan.diaz\@ipla.csic.es](mailto:juan.diaz@ipla.csic.es){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}
